description: Protective warmth arising from deepening love attachment - a sudden swell of caring closeness.
actor_description: It comes on as warmth before it becomes thought—an easing under my ribs, like my body recognizes them as safe and important. My breathing slows without permission. My shoulders loosen. I feel pulled toward them in a simple, steady way. Not hunger. Not panic. Just this quiet certainty: you matter to me. I want to keep them close enough to protect, close enough to be useful. My voice goes softer. I find myself angling my body toward them like that's the most natural thing in the world.
description_text: {actor} softens visibly—features easing, attention settling with unhurried steadiness. They orient toward the person they care about, closing distance by small degrees: a half-step nearer, a protective angle of the shoulders, a warmth in the face that doesn't ask permission.

alternate_descriptions.tactile: Someone's presence feels grounding—steady and warm, like someone has decided to stay.
